Welcome to my world.

Ships fall apart and explode on the pad as soon as they're launched. StructurAL linkage failure is guarenteed , even with stuts attached, and if you do manage to launch, it's bound to explode for no apparent reason on its suborbit. If somehow it does make it into orbit, DO NOT TIME WARP, EVER. I swear, time warp is a self destruct button

Most annoying thing in(volved) in KSP... well its me! There is always some part that I've missed, or some stupid action that can't be undone (without losing hours of progress). There's dodgy designing, which could have been avoided by taking an additional second to check things over before hitting launch. There's the impatient time accelerating. And alas, all the returning chickens, I inadvertently invited to roost. Shame on me.

Hmm that's weird... I had quite a bit of problems with using service bays and the thing with a z-200 battery (one of 4) exploding on every launch (apparently all the heat got dumped into that poor thing after staging).

A couple of things.

1. THE LAGGGGG!!!!! I have 8 installs just to get round this probkem

2. Wobbly Rocket Syndrome. Almost all of those 8 installs have KJR, except for the stock install.

For me, it's the fact that atmospheric heating effects appear (in my opinion) way too high up, long after the atmosphere has faded to the point of not even affecting your craft. Maybe an astronaut can chime in. ("When I rode in Soyuz, the flames started appearing long before we felt any drag from it, so KSP is indeed realistic!")

The most annoying thing: No stock weather system (clouds!) and constant game crashes with standard sized craft (>500 parts)

THATS your "standard" size!?!

Where are people getting these arbitrary part counts that KSP "should" be able to handle?

What are you running it on, Deep Blue?

I flew something that was 1100 parts on the pad and around 700 in orbit and had no crashes. The worst lag I've ever experienced in KSP, seconds-per-frame and two hours to reach orbit, but the game was perfectly stable. (Thankfully. I might well have thrown my PC on the floor if KSP had crashed during that launch.)
Definitely no weather and lack of a better looking atmosphere in the stock game. Another is that there are no other stock launch sites. I am also aware that there are mods to remedy these complaints.
I don't think I've ever made a rocket with more than about 120 parts.

Exaaaaaaaaactly. And also, recently I've been plotting courses where I leave Kerbin's SOI at a very small relative velocity, single-digit m/s, but AWAY from Kerbin. The conics show me exit Kerbin's SOI, and go on my merry way like you'd expect. In truth what happens is, I exit Kerbin's SOI, go about 10 meters, and then re-enter Kerbin's SOI to take a trip around the ellipse.

My most annoying thing in KSP is when I'm in the Map view, lining up a flight path on a target (I see this when trying to rendezvous with planets and ships, both) and the various markers blip around on the screen like the game is having a seizure. I really need to read the periapsis altitude, but I can't because it keeps moving around. Or sometimes disappearing completely and reappearing ten times a second, each time with widely different numbers. GAAAAAHHHH!
